segment.source: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature
segment.target: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature

segment.source: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature
segment.target: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature

segment.source: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature
segment.target: Prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration Feature

segment.source: If you deploy MBAM with the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, we recommend a three-server architecture, as described in High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
segment.target: If you deploy MBAM with the System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology, we recommend a three-server architecture, as described in High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.

segment.source: This architecture can support 500,000 client computers.
segment.target: This architecture can support 500,000 client computers.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Windows To Go is not supported for the Configuration Manager Integration topology installation when you are using Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: Windows To Go is not supported for the Configuration Manager Integration topology installation when you are using Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: General prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration feature
segment.target: General prerequisites for the Configuration Manager Integration feature

segment.source: When you install MBAM with Configuration Manager, the following additional prerequisites are required in addition to the prerequisites for the Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: When you install MBAM with Configuration Manager, the following additional prerequisites are required in addition to the prerequisites for the Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: Prerequisite
segment.target: Prerequisite

segment.source: Additional information
segment.target: Additional information

segment.source: The Configuration Manager Server is a primary site in the Configuration Manager system.
segment.target: The Configuration Manager Server is a primary site in the Configuration Manager system.

segment.source: N/A
segment.target: N/A

segment.source: The Hardware Inventory Client Agent is on the Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: The Hardware Inventory Client Agent is on the Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory for a Site.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory for a Site.

segment.source: One of the following is enabled, depending on the version of Configuration Manager that you are using:
segment.target: One of the following is enabled, depending on the version of Configuration Manager that you are using:

segment.source: Compliance Settings - (System Center 2012 Configuration Manager)
segment.target: Compliance Settings - (System Center 2012 Configuration Manager)

segment.source: Desired Configuration Management (DCM) Client Agent – (Configuration Manager 2007)
segment.target: Desired Configuration Management (DCM) Client Agent – (Configuration Manager 2007)

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Configuring Compliance Settings in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Configuring Compliance Settings in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, see Desired Configuration Management Client Agent Properties.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, see Desired Configuration Management Client Agent Properties.

segment.source: A reporting services point is defined in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: A reporting services point is defined in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Required for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
segment.target: Required for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Prerequisites for Reporting in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Prerequisites for Reporting in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Create a Reporting Services Point for SQL Reporting Services.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Create a Reporting Services Point for SQL Reporting Services.

segment.source: Configuration Manager 2007 requires Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0
segment.target: Configuration Manager 2007 requires Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0

segment.source: The Desired Configuration Management (DCM) Client Agent in Configuration Manager 2007 requires .NET Framework 2.0 to report compliance.
segment.target: The Desired Configuration Management (DCM) Client Agent in Configuration Manager 2007 requires .NET Framework 2.0 to report compliance.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Installing .NET Framework 3.5 automatically installs .NET Framework 2.0.
segment.target: Installing .NET Framework 3.5 automatically installs .NET Framework 2.0.

segment.source: Required permissions to install MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Required permissions to install MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: To install MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must have an administrative user in Configuration Manager who has a security role with the minimum permissions listed in the following table.
segment.target: To install MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must have an administrative user in Configuration Manager who has a security role with the minimum permissions listed in the following table.

segment.source: The table also shows the rights that you must have, beyond basic computer administrator rights, to install the MBAM Server.
segment.target: The table also shows the rights that you must have, beyond basic computer administrator rights, to install the MBAM Server.

segment.source: The permissions in the following table apply to both versions of Configuration Manager.
segment.target: The permissions in the following table apply to both versions of Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Permissions
segment.target: Permissions

segment.source: MBAM Server feature
segment.target: MBAM Server feature

segment.source: SQL Server instance login server roles: - dbcreator- processadmin
segment.target: SQL Server instance login server roles: - dbcreator- processadmin

segment.source: Recovery Database- Audit Database
segment.target: Recovery Database- Audit Database

segment.source: SSRS instance rights: - Create Folders- Publish Reports
segment.target: SSRS instance rights: - Create Folders- Publish Reports

segment.source: System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.target: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager

segment.target: Permissions

segment.target: Configuration Manager site rights:- Read

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.target: Configuration Manager collection rights: - Create- Delete- Read- Modify- Deploy Configuration Items

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: Required changes for the .mof files
segment.target: Required changes for the .mof files

segment.source: To enable the client computers to report BitLocker compliance details through the MBAM Configuration Manager reports, you have to edit the Configuration.mof file and Smsdef.mof file for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager and Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: To enable the client computers to report BitLocker compliance details through the MBAM Configuration Manager reports, you have to edit the Configuration.mof file and Smsdef.mof file for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager and Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: For instructions, see MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
segment.target: For instructions, see MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
